data.title: Add --replay-metadata utility command.
data.body:
For @ihptru.  Mod ID and version will be included in the output once #7353 is merged.

Sample output:


data.title: Introduce ActorPreviewWidget (and other related changes).
data.body:
There are three parts to this pr:
1. Make the IRenderable structs properly immutable, and introduce a new type for prepared renderables.
2. Introduce the `ActorPreviewWidget` itself.
3. Replace the hacky `SpriteSequenceWidget` used by the color pickers with `ActorPreviewWidget`.

https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/editor provides a heavier testcase of `ActorPreviewWidget`.

data.title: Fixed the faction insignia being drawn over the radar minimap
data.body: An oversight introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7384.

data.title: Show revision number in map description
data.body: It is possible to upload different versions of the same map to the resource center. But in game lobby and also in server list it is not possible to see which version of the map is chosen, since all versions have the same name.

data.title: Combat caused by Lua actor command clears entire queue
data.body:
When doing for example:

```
unit.Hunt()
unit.AttackMove(waypoint7.Location)
unit.AttackMove(waypoint94.Location)
```

Or another example:

```
unit.AttackMove(waypoint7.Location)
unit.Hunt()
```

(where unit is a valid actor)

If the unit gets in a firefight but does not die it goes idle after the fight. It does not complete the action it was doing or any subsequent actions on the queue. It looks like the whole queue is emptied when a single bullet is fired upon the unit or the unit fires itself.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8431797-combat-caused-by-lua-actor-command-clears-entire-queue?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Can not order Actor.Attack command
data.body:
I tried ordering an e1 actor(infantry) to attack a building. The game crashes and reports: Actor 'e1' does not define a property 'Attack'

The Lua API says void Attack(Actor target) => Fly an attack against the target actor. Requires Trait: AttackPlane.

It seems this command is for aircraft only so this means there is no command for non-aircraft actors to attack anything?!?

Full log:

Fatal Lua Error: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Uncaught CLR exception at Lua->CLR boundary: System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> Eluant.LuaException: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'e1' does not define a property 'Attack'
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.Call(IList`1 args)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.Call(LuaFunction fn, IList`1 args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.UtilsGlobal.Do(LuaValue[] collection, LuaFunction func)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.UnsafeInvokeInternal(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Object[] arguments)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptMemberWrapper.Invoke(LuaVararg args)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.UnsafeInvokeInternal(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Object[] arguments)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.MethodWrapper.Invoke(Object[] parms)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.MakeManagedCall(IntPtr state, MethodWrapper wrapper)
   at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptContext.FatalError(String message)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.TriggerGlobal.<AfterDelay>c__AnonStorey78.<>m__D6()
   at OpenRA.Effects.DelayedAction.<Tick>m__20C(World w)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Re-order the production icons when Build Everything is enabled
data.body:
Just a suggestion but I think it could be interesting to re-order the production icons when Build Everything is enabled.

Current "mess" :
![screen shot 02-09-15 at 07 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/6113486/1536aefe-b098-11e4-992d-bee8c583e4be.PNG)

Re-ordered icons:
![sssssssssss2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/6113496/2115ebb8-b098-11e4-8929-148be8b2f0b2.png)

Maybe to fill the gap, we could add a 1x1 concrete icon?
(the gap doesn't bother me but @penev92 suggested on IRC that there could be a 1x1 concrete..)

This new order of icons would only happen when Build Everything is enabled.
No need to reorder the icons for normal default games.

What do you think?

data.title: Server stops after game Timeout has passed
data.body:
I've had this twice now. My server stops when the set Timeout for a game has passed. Last log entry: `Timeout at 02/08/2015 20:18:37!!!`.

This is what I found in the code: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blame/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L692
I believe the `Server.TimeOut` shouldn't cause the program to exit when `Server.DedicatedLoop = True`.

Apart from exiting when the timer (`gameTimer`) times out, it looks like the timer itself is never canceled. Shouldn't the timer be canceled once the game is over?

Full logs:

```
Platform is Linux
Using Null renderer
Using Null sound engine which disables SFX completely
Available mods:
cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20141029)
d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20141029)
modchooser: Mod Chooser (release-20141029)
ra: Red Alert (release-20141029)
Loading mod: ra
Game started
No one is playing, shutting down...
Starting a new server instance...
Game started
No one is playing, shutting down...
Starting a new server instance...
Game started
Timeout at 02/08/2015 20:18:37!!!
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8428988-server-stops-after-game-timeout-has-passed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Escape key does not work in menu
data.body:
In the RA mod (other mods not tested), go to single player, skirmish.

Pressing the escape key here does not go back to the menu like in all other menu's. Not sure if this is intended for some reason?

data.title: Game Balance
data.body:
- Corrected tech tree, energy consumptions, descriptions and buildlding costs of all units and buildings for both GDI and NOD and build times of units and structures according to the original game.

See WiKi entry for more info: 
- [Game Balancing](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Game-Balancing)
- [Unit Specific Balance](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Unit-Specific-Balance)

data.title: Ability to mute players in the game lobby and ingame
data.body:
Title is self explanatory. If the country flags are going to stay the ability to mute certain players will be useful. Country of origin easily becomes a target for trolls. Something like /ignore or a mute checkbox could fill the need.

data.title: Underscore is not shown in lobby chat
data.body: If the last message in lobby chat (the one at the very bottom) has an underscore ( _ ), it is not shown until another message pushes it upward. This functionality is essential for the use of the smiley ._.

data.title: Fix #7431
data.body: SliderWidget.Value does not call OnChange, so do it manually. Should fix #7431.

data.title: Fixes #7219. In addition, sets cursor corresponding to the order with hi...
data.body:
...ghest priority.

While fixing #7219 I noticed that cursors do not correspond to the orders with highest priority. I went ahead and fixed this in what I think is the best way possible, select orders that have a cursor and take the one with highest priority. Testing confirms that these issues are fixed, and it is highly unlikely that this breaks functionality elsewhere.

data.title: Add an option to invert the sidebar (UI) position
data.body:
As suggested on IRC, it could be interesting to have an option to invert the sidebar (UI) position from right to left (and maybe also useful for left-handed people ?).

A checkbox (in Options) could let the player invert the UI.
But as @pchote mentioned it, support powers, timers, perf graph... would also have to flip to the right.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8396646-add-an-option-to-invert-the-sidebar-ui-position?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: ConfigurableStartingUnits can not be updated by map.yaml
data.body:
After some discussion on IRC I was asked to file a ticket about this.

See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Map/Map.cs#L70

ConfigurableStartingUnits seems to be hard coded to true and in  public void UpdateServerSettings(Session.Global settings) there is also no updating done.

I have not tested this in game but people suggested this might be a bug.

data.title: SAM site stays after being sold during low-power
data.body:
![sam](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/6096234/4d6ab9c8-af8f-11e4-8c4e-e6b2adfd0db0.png)

It was targeting a plane while looking like that. I had to press sell multiple times before it was sold properly. This is in release-20141029. Might be related to #6076.

update button positions to a more logical place

i couldn't put the change map button exactly where i wanted, but at least the disconnect / back and the start game, and the change map are not i a place where i think its less confusing for the players.

data.title: Fix map importer using the map title as the output filename.
data.body: This is broken because the map title can make an invalid filename. The bug currently prevents people from importing the second Soviet mission as-is because its title is `<none>` in the ini file.

data.title: Add support for animated build icons

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Requested at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=17070.

This would be trivial to implement (just replace `ProductionIcon.Sprite` → `ProductionIcon.Animation` and `Tick()` it), except that the production palette blows away and recreates the icon state every tick.  That is stupidly inefficient, and should be fixed even if we don't want to animate them.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8376883-add-support-for-animated-build-icons?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: added nod mission 2b
data.body: So this mission is very similar to 2a.

data.title: Move the AI to Mods.Common
data.body: Currently based on #7435

data.title: Moving more files to Mods.Common
data.body:
As promised some time ago, I'm moving the harvester and refinery logic to Mods.Common now that all classes and interfaces have proper names.
Also removed the unused interface `IAcceptOreDockAction` and the now-empty `TraitsInterfaces.cs` in Mods.RA.

With this TS no longer has any **class** dependencies on RA.
D2k hasn't had for some time now.

Second commit moves `MainMenuLogic.cs` to Mods.Common, which is the last **class** dependency that TD has on RA.

I will make another PR shortly to clean up project/DLL references in the mod projects.

data.title: Select by type key doesn't work
data.body: By pressing W key once, it is possible to select all units of the same type that are on screen. By double pressing it all same type units on the map are selected. Once this double pressing has been used, it is not possible to activate the one-press behaviour again. Any press of W will select all units on the entire map.

data.title: Building on the TD Shellmap, plus some more lua bindings
data.body:
I'm rewriting the lua script for the TD shellmap given it's lack of actual activity. It still has quite a bit to go as you can see but it does far more than the current script already.

Update: Fixed all noted errors and added the actual production scripting to make it a more active shellmap. I'm not really concerned with adding more activity to the map but it could use a couple things like having an orca group fly in for the helipads, maybe adding an A-10 airstrike somewhere, or having Nod fly in an infantry group across the eastern river to attack across the bridge.

data.title: Add sequences for the Clustermissile
data.body: This PR makes the Clustermissile visible, the down sequence is missing projectiles, thats why the UP and Down sequence are the same :)

data.title: Music is muted after volume changing and reset =(
data.body: When we changing the volume of the Musik to Zero and clicking reset, the music doesnt Play anymore

data.title: [Discussion PR] Complete refactor of Pathfinder
data.body:
The whole intent of this pull request is basically to review and discuss the changes I introduced in the pathfinder architecture and algorithm, find better solutions and guide the development to a better version. According to unit test benchmarks and some playtests I've thrown in, I've achieved approximately a 20% increased performance in the pathfinder. However, I need some help in order to implement integration tests to make some real and better pathfinding benchmarking as it seems quite complex to create Map, Actor and World instances and I'm not fully aware of how it works.

If someone wants to test in-game differences between legacy pathfinder and the new pathfinder, he or she should simply go to the file OpenRA.Mods.Common\Traits\World\Pathfinder\PathFinderInfo.cs and change the line "return new PathFinderCacheDecorator(new PathFinder(init.World), new PathCacheStorage(init.World));" to "return new PathFinderCacheDecorator(new LegacyPathFinder(init.World), new PathCacheStorage(init.World));". This is one of the advantages of the changes I introduced, it's rather easy to switch implementation strategies.

The next steps after re-architecting the pathfinder should be to improve the A\* algorithm. The 0 A.D. (another great opensource RTS game) provides some interesting documentation and strategies they use for their pathfinder: https://github.com/0ad/0ad/blob/master/docs/pathfinder.tex

I made a complete refactor of the Pathfinder trait, based upon PR #7358. The goals of these changes are:
- Isolate the dependencies (by extracting interfaces of classes like
  Actor, Map and World) of the pathfinder trait and A\* algorithm and
  allow testability
- Follow software engineering design patterns and best practices (SOLID
  design principles) to create smaller, focused and isolated classes and
  methods to allow to easily swap, create and benchmark different implementations
  (through dependency injection), extend functionality and follow the SRP
  principle and, of course, easier to read and understand.
- Detect redundant calculations and unfitted data structures for several
  problems
- Ultimately, performance improvements

In detail, the changes introduced in this commit are the following:
- The changes in PR #7358 (fragmented methods from the Expand algorithm,
  fragmented the caching capabilities from the PathFinder class,
  introduced interfaces to Actor, Map, and World classes, enabled unit
  testability.
- Fragmented the whole code which regards to pathfinding into several
  files, placed inside its own folder "Pathfinder".
- Improved the path cache (PathCacheStorage class) to work with a
  Dictionary structure instead of a list for faster lookups and removals
- Modified the CellLayer class to work with the Prototype design pattern,
  and encapsulated this functionality in the class instead of making the
  PathSearch class responsible for it.
- Code which lookup up for "PathFinder" trait now looks for the
  "IPathFinder" trait.
- Extracted interface in the PriorityQueue class to be able to work with
  both the former implementation or with a .Net SortedSet data structure.
  Using one implementation or the other should be dependant on benchmarks
  and use cases (Insertions in SorterSet are O(log n), removals and
  Min lookups are O(1) while insertions in PriorityQueue are O(1) but Pops
  are O(n log n)).
- Extracted interface for the PathSearch class so we can provide different
  implementations for the A\* algorithm. 2 implementations for PathSearch
  and Pathfinder are provided
  currently: LegacyPathFinder and LegacyPathSearch (which contains the
  same implementation as the former PathSearch class, only adapted to work
  with interfaces, which has negligible penalty cost) and PathFinder and
  PathSearch, which contains tweaked modifications of the A*, mobileinfo
  and different data structures which are better fit with their usage.
  This last implementation should be faster.
- Provided more unit tests for benchmarking.

data.title: Change the ingame diplomacys close buttons hotkey from esc to p.
data.body: A bit faster and more logical IMO.
